result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:33 AM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Daniel P Berczyk.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status. 
In case 22CF1405: 
The defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.
Court finds the defendant knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their right to a preliminary hearing and finds probable cause to bind over the defendant over for trial.
Information filed.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
State sends consolidated offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

2:48 PM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Daniel P Berczyk. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. The Court will set this matter for status of prelim before the Trial Court to tag along with the defendant's other matter. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
